body: This basically started happening after 1.76.0 came out 23 days ago, I've had a look at the compiled code and indeed there were a few things added which made it happen

issue.title: At-rules may not be used within keyframe blocks

repository.name: dart-sass
repository.description: The reference implementation of Sass, written in Dart.

issue.title: Allow @-rules in `@keyframes` blocks
issue.body:
This is a fast-track proposal.

Closes #3859

body: I agree that this behavior is incorrect. The CSS spec [allows at-rules in `<declaration-list>` productions](https://www.w3.org/TR/css-syntax-3/#typedef-declaration-list), which is what `@keyframes` blocks contain.

issue.title: Allow at-rules in `@keyframes` blocks

repository.name: dart-sass
repository.description: The reference implementation of Sass, written in Dart.

issue.body:
See sass/sass#3859
See sass/sass#3861
See sass/sass-spec#1987
